item.title: Dawn add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "Words ought to be a little wild for they are the assault of thoughts on the unthinking." -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dawn add a quote by David Hilbert
item.description: "The infinite! No other question has ever moved so profoundly the spirit of man." -- David Hilbert

item.title: Dawn add a quote by John McPhee
item.description: "If you free yourself from the conventional reaction to a quantity like a million years, you free yourself a bit from the boundaries of human time. And then in a way you do not live at all, but in another way you live forever." -- John McPhee

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Émile Michel Cioran
item.description: "If we could truly see ourselves the way others see us we'd disappear on the spot." -- Émile Michel Cioran

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Finnerty shook his head. "He'd pull me back into the center, and I want to stay as close on the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." He nodded, "Big, undreamed-of things -- the people on the edge see them first." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't you think it would be wonderful to get rid of everything and everybody and just go some place where you don't know a soul?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "In this world, there are things you can only do alone, and things you can only do with somebody else. It's important to combine the two in just the right amount." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "The pure present is an ungraspable advance of the past devouring the future. In truth, all sensation is already memory." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Things like that happen all the time in this great big world of ours. It's like taking a boat out on a beautiful lake on a beautiful day and thinking both the sky and the lake are beautiful. So stop eating yourself up alive. Things will go where they're supposed to go if you just let them take their natural course." -- Haruki Murakami
